poem:
### Spiral

A jersey threaded with echoes,  
each tackle a symphony of collisions—  
head against helmet, mind against bone.  
Notes scrawled like fragile confessions,  
concussions counted like marks in dust.  
Four lives folded into the grass,  
a shooting star flares out.  
Inside his skull,  
pain echoes the empty stadium's roar.  
A game with rules never written.
